gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration.

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles initialization, termination calibration, and dynamic calibration of DQS (Data Strobe) signals. The module manages various calibration stages, including RZQ (reference impedance) and ZIO (zero impedance) calibration, P-term and N-term adjustments, and DQS delay calibration. It uses a state machine to control the calibration process, adjusting termination values and DQS delays to optimize memory interface performance. The module also handles self-refresh requests and supports different memory types. Overall, it aims to improve signal integrity and timing for memory operations.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START

Explanation:
- UI_CLK: Main clock input for the module
- RST: Reset signal
- PLL_LOCK: PLL lock signal
- SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request signal
- SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Self-refresh MCB mode signal
- RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Reference impedance and zero impedance inputs
- RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: SDO signals for RZQ and ZIO IODRPs
- MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB status signals
- MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB data and command signals
- MCB_UO_CAL_START: Calibration start signal from MCB

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train

Explanation:
- DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Indicates completion of soft and hard calibration
- SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh control signals
- IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP control signals
- RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: Chip select signals for RZQ and ZIO IODRPs
- MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST: MCB control signals
- MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB address and control signals
- MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: DQ calibration control signals
- MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: LDQS and UDQS calibration control signals
- MCB_UIREAD, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB control and status signals
- MCB_SYSRST: System reset signal for MCB
- Max_Value: Maximum calibration value
- CKE_Train: CKE training signal

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done.

Explanation:
- STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration state machine.
- P_Term, N_Term: Store the P-termination and N-termination values.
- P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed versions of P-term and N-term values.
- P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous P-term and N-term values for comparison.
- IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: Address of the IODRP memory cell being accessed.
- IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Data to be written to the IODRP.
- Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP is currently active (RZQ, ZIO, or MCB_PORT).
- IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: Read/Write control for IODRP operations.
- IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signals for IODRP and MCB operations.
- IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_USE_BKST: Broadcast mode control signals.
- Pre_SYSRST: Internal reset signal for MCB.
- IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data output.
- Max_Value_Previous: Stores the previous maximum calibration value.
- count, counter_en: Counter and enable signal for timing operations.
- First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Indicates completion of first dynamic calibration.
- DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values for calibration.
- counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations.
- RST_reg: Registered reset signal.
- Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations.
- MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered version of MCB_UODATAVALID.
- LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the last calibration pass type.
- First_In_Term_Done: Indicates completion of first in-termination calibration.
